Text: Tescott unit On Helen called the oncall for Tescott concerning a hi gas detection alarm shed received at the station Gary went out to check the alarm and found out that the prelube oil pump on unit which is gas powered was leaking which caused the alarm Parts for this unit may not be available until next Monday which in turn means unit will be unavailable until then Gary confered with Kim on this and relayed to us that if any compression is needed on the high side unit is ready and can be switched over for us at any time Crandal

Farmington operationsFarmington Units Availability Unit Currently running west to Willmar Unit Working on today but should be available before they go home Unit Currently running west to Willmar Unit Available Unit Not Available Finishing up inspections Unit Available Will require a call out In local mode so it cannot be started from Houston Want to make sure it is the best option do to power demand charges incurred Unit Available
Eldorado PlantRodney talked to one of the plant operators today and was told to disregard any low air alarms til further noticethe air compressors are down
